title: Café Rouge owner seals La Tasca takeover just days after Las Iguanas deal
text:

Sat, Jul 18, 2015, 20:22 BST - UK Markets closed Café Rouge owner seals La Tasca takeover just days after Las Iguanas deal By Ashley Armstrong | Telegraph – 15 minutes ago 35.50 -2.79 
A £26m takeover of La Tasca will mean Casual Dining Group will own four of the UK's best known restaurant chains 
The owner of Café Rouge and Bella Italia is in exclusive talks to buy Spanish restaurant chain La Tasca, just days after gobbling up rival Las Iguanas . 
Casual Dining Group’s imminent deal, expected to be agreed for £26m, will put four of the UK’s best-known restaurant brands under one roof. 
The flurry of deals comes less than a year after Casual Dining Group, or Tragus as it was formerly known, was forced to undergo a restructuring process that required it to sell off Strada, the Italian restaurant chain. 
The painful company voluntary arrangement enabled it to cut its debts by £263m and led to US debt fund Apollo taking control of the remaining chains Cafe Rouge and Bella Italia. 
The restaurant group, which is now run by former Tiger Tiger nightclub boss Steve Richards, has put deal-making firmly back on the agenda, amid speculation that Apollo is building up Casual Dining Group in preparation for a potential stock market listing which would allow it to quickly cash in on some of its investment. 
The company has seen off competition from rival restaurant chain Prezzo, to snap up La Tasca. The La Tasca auction is being handled by BDO. The restaurant is currently owned by Icelandic bank Kaupthing and German lender Commerzbank (Xetra: CBK100 - news ) , which took control from entrepreneur Robert Tchenguiz in a debt-for-equity swap in 2013. The chain struggled after the recession with soaring liabilities and became addicted to discounting including “all you can eat” promotions. 
Recently, La Tasca has overhauled its menus, ditching frozen foods and making meals more authentic by working with Spanish suppliers. 
La Tasca sells traditional Spanish food including paella and tapas dishes 
The sale of La Tasca comes on the back of a string of restaurant deals with investors keen to involve themselves with the booming consumer trend of eating and drinking out as the economy improves. 
Last week CBPE, a private equity firm, sold French restaurant chain Cote to rival BC Partners for £250m, while Prezzo was recently taken private by TPG (Taiwan OTC: 6521.TWO - news ) . The chain was founded by leisure moguls the Kaye family, who also created the Garfunkels, Café Uno and Ask and Zizzi restaurant chains.
